medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening headaches, coarsening facial features, and accelerated growth.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 year prior to presentation with gradual worsening of headaches and noticeable growth acceleration (13 cm per year) starting 18 months before presentation. Previously, the patient had height below the 5th percentile since birth. The headaches worsened progressively over 1 year.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A family history of Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia Type 1 (MEN 1) is noted. The patient has pituitary macroadenoma associated with familial MEN 1.
medical_history.family_history: The father was diagnosed with primary hyperparathyroidism in his 20s. Two paternal aunts had parathyroid disease, and one underwent transsphenoidal surgery for a prolactinoma at age 51.
